bug.author: Akeepers
bug.summary: Some expired URLs on the website https://www.mlpack.org
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Problem location</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://www.mlpack.org/doc/mlpack-3.0.4/doxygen/python_quickstart.html>python quickstart</denchmark-link>
Python mlpack binding documentations mlpack C++ tutorials Simple sample C++ mlpack programs mlpack Doxygen documentation homepage
<denchmark-h:h4>Description of problem</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h6>404</denchmark-h>
Not Found

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Akeepers>@Akeepers</denchmark-link> nice picture, looks like Spotify. Are the links mentioned somewhere?

I think they are mentioned in the documentation on the new site that is for the old versions. Probably I can just fix this with some regex on the Doxygen documentation for old versions. I'll do that when I have a chance (so it will be a little while) unless someone beats me to it with the scripts on mlpack.org. But I am not sure those are very easy to approach...
Ahh, haven't checked the python quickstart link.
Replace http://www.mlpack.org/docs/* with http://www.mlpack.org/doc/* I tried, but it still doesn't work. Actually, I found more expired URLs in Wiki, such as list of tutorials
No need to close this yet, I still have one or two things to fix. üëç Working on it, but rebuilding the website is a bit slow.
It took me a while but I finally got this to work right. Let me know if you find any more issues, and thanks for reporting! üëç
